required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Pilot RCT Comparing Effectiveness of Two Decision Aids for Hip and Knee Osteoarthritis
clinical_study.official_title: Pilot RCT Comparing Effectiveness of Two Decision Aids for Hip and Knee Osteoarthritis

brief_summary.textblock: This pilot RCT study is to examine the comparative effectiveness of two decision aids for hip and knee osteoarthritis.

detailed_description.textblock: This pilot RCT study is to examine the comparative effectiveness of two decision aids for hip and knee osteoarthritis. The vendors employ different design features (e.g. use of video for patient narratives, interactive values clarification exercise) and the study will examine the relative impact of the different features on decision quality. Eligible subjects will be randomly assigned to receive one of two decision aids before their upcoming clinic visit with a participating provider. Immediately before the visit, participants will complete a short questionnaire about the decision aid. This pilot study will assist with determining the potential difference between these two decision aids on improving knowledge and use of decision aids.

primary_outcome.measure: Hip and Knee Decision Quality Instruments Knowledge Subscale Scores
primary_outcome.time_frame: In clinic, immediately before the first visit with surgeon
primary_outcome.description: 5 multiple choice knowledge items from the Hip and Knee Decision Quality Instruments will be averaged into a knowledge subscale score (0-100%) with higher scores indicating higher knowledge.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Who Used the Decision Aid
secondary_outcome.time_frame: In clinic, immediately before the first visit with surgeon
secondary_outcome.description: 1 item asking patients how much they reviewed the program (none, some. most, all). The percentage who report viewing most or all will be calculated.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With a Clear Treatment Preference
secondary_outcome.time_frame: In clinic, immediately before the first visit with surgeon
secondary_outcome.description: 1 item assessing patient's treatment preference (surgery, non-surgical options, or not sure). The percentage who have a clear preference (either for surgery or non surgical options) will be calculated.

arm_group.description: Group receiving brief interactive decision aid. The decision aids are the Shared Decision Points for hip and knee osteoarthritis from Healthwise
Group receiving long video decision aids. The decision aids are the hip or knee DVD and Booklets for hip and knee osteoarthritis from Health Dialog

intervention.description: The Healthwise Shared Decision Points in booklet version for hip and knee osteoarthritis
Health Dialog DVD and booklet decision aids for hip and knee osteoarthritis

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosis of either hip or knee osteoarthritis
- Scheduled visit with participating orthopedic surgeon
Exclusion Criteria:
- Prior partial or total knee or hip replacement surgery
- Hip fracture or aseptic necrosis in the last 12 months
- Rheumatoid arthritis or psoriatic arthritis
- Unable to read or speak English

reference.citation: Sepucha K, Feibelmann S, Chang Y, Clay CF, Kearing SA, Tomek I, Yang T, Katz JN. Factors associated with the quality of patients' surgical decisions for treatment of hip and knee osteoarthritis. J Am Coll Surg. 2013 Oct;217(4):694-701. doi: 10.1016/j.jamcollsurg.2013.06.002. Epub 2013 Jul 25.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Patient recruitment was conducted from December 2015 to March 2016. Patients were recruited at two hospitals. Consent for the study (or enrollment) was implied by completion of the survey, so the enrollment number is lower than the number that started the study and were assigned to a study arm.

group.title: Interactive Decision Aid
group.description: Group receiving brief interactive decision aid. The decision aids are the Shared Decision Points for hip and knee osteoarthritis from Healthwise Brief interactive decision aid: The Healthwise Shared Decision Points in booklet version for hip and knee osteoarthritis

group.title: Video Decision Aid
group.description: Group receiving long video decision aids. The decision aids are the hip or knee DVD and Booklets for hip and knee osteoarthritis from Health Dialog Long video decision aid: Health Dialog DVD and booklet decision aids for hip and knee osteoarthritis

baseline.population: The study participants between both groups were quite balanced. Mean age and gender did not have any significant differences based on group assignment.

measure.title: Sex: Female, Male
measure.description: Gender data was collected through chart review of enrolled patients.

measure.title: Race and Ethnicity Not Collected
measure.population: Race and Ethnicity were not collected from any participant.

outcome.title: Hip and Knee Decision Quality Instruments Knowledge Subscale Scores
outcome.description: 5 multiple choice knowledge items from the Hip and Knee Decision Quality Instruments will be averaged into a knowledge subscale score (0-100%) with higher scores indicating higher knowledge.
outcome.time_frame: In clinic, immediately before the first visit with surgeon
outcome.population: The total knowledge score of 5 multiple questions with a total score of 0-100% was generated for all study patients.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants Who Used the Decision Aid
outcome.description: 1 item asking patients how much they reviewed the program (none, some. most, all). The percentage who report viewing most or all will be calculated.
outcome.time_frame: In clinic, immediately before the first visit with surgeon
outcome.population: We wanted to assess how much patients reviewed whichever decision aid they were randomized to before their visit. As such, we assessed how much they reviewed of the program (none, some, most, all) and will share the categorical results.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
